qa_pairs.question: Ano ang nangyari sa aklat na ito?
qa_pairs.answer: Isang mabibigat na pag-aalsa ng isang mangingisda sa forest.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang aklat na ito ay naglalaman ng isang mahalagang leksiyon tungkol sa kabaitan at tiwala. Sa katunayan, naiintindihan natin ang kahalagahan ng pag-aalsa ng isang mangingisda para sa kaniyang kapwa at sa pamilya niya.
qa_pairs.context:
The Two Woodcutters 
and the Elf 
ONE AFTERNOON a poor woodcutter entered the forest to 
chop down atree for firewood. He chose a tall, straight 
tree beside a dark lake and started swinging his axe. The 
ring of the axe echoed and reechoed through the wilder- 
ness. 
The woodcutter worked fast, for he hoped to finish 
cutting down the tree before nightfall. But the blade of his 
axe became loose, slipped off the handle, and fell into the 
lake. 
The man dived into the water to find the blade, b

qa_pairs.question: Anong naging resulta sa pakikibaka ng mangingisda?
qa_pairs.answer: Nakuha ang aksaya niya at pinakita ang kabaitan ng mangingisda.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang pag-aalsa ng mangingisda ay nagbigay-daan sa kaniyang pamilya na makabuhay dahil sa aksaya na nakuhang sa katapusan. Sa Filipino culture, ang kabaitan at pagtutulungan ay mahalaga para sa komunidad.
qa_pairs.context:

qa_pairs.question: Who helped the woodcutter find his lost axe blade?
qa_pairs.answer: An elf
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino culture, the 'aswang' and other supernatural beings are often depicted as benevolent helpers to those in need. The elf in this story shares similar traits, highlighting the importance of kindness and generosity towards others.
qa_pairs.context:
“I was cutting a tree beside a lake in the woods,” the 
other replied, “when the ade of my axe slipped off and 
fell into the water. I cou! not find it, and an elf came. 
She not only found the blade for me but she gave me these 
two as well.” The woodcutter said nothing else, for he 
was not a man of many words. 
“Tell me how to get there,” said the other. “I want to 
go and try my luck, too.” 
The woodcutter told him how to find the way to the 
lake. Then the other hurried home; took his old a

qa_pairs.question: What was the woodcutter's ultimate fate after being helped by the elf?
qa_pairs.answer: He walked home feeling ashamed
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino culture, honesty is highly valued, and the woodcutter's dishonesty ultimately led to his downfall. This story serves as a reminder of the importance of integrity and moral character in our daily lives.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang pangalan ng lolo na nagsasagawa ng mga gawain sa palay at yam?
qa_pairs.answer: Ang lalaki ay tinatawag na "The Old Woman".
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Tinatawag na siya bilang "Ina" o may-ari ng bahay, isang katumbas ng paggalang sa mga lola at ina sa kultura Pilipino.
qa_pairs.context:
The Wee Folk. 
THE OLD WOMAN finished winnowing rice under the 
bamboo tree just as the sun set. She piled up the chaff ina 
mound as high as an anthill and built a slow fire with the 
chaff. Then she went into her garden and dug up some 
yams, and she put the yams in the slow fire. 
“When I wake up tomorrow morning,” she told her- 
self, “the yams will be just right for breakfast.” 
She went into her hut and cooked supper, and then 
she ate and went to bed. 
The cocks had not been crowing long

qa_pairs.question: Anong dahilan kung bakit pinagtatawanan ang mga kiba-an?
qa_pairs.answer: Ang mga kiba-an ay natatakot sa tao dahil sila ay maaaring mangyari sa kanila kapag nilason.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Sa katulad ng anumang panrebelion o di-tiyak na naitutuwa ng mga demonyo, ang mga kiba-an ay ipinagkakaabono bilang pagtatawanan sa kultura Pilipino dahil sila ay inilalarawan bilang mga malisyosong entidad ngunit mayaman sa kahalayan at tunay na mahuhusay.

qa_pairs.question: What was the king's request to his three sons?
qa_pairs.answer: He asked them to go and look for their wives so he could see them married before he died.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The king's request reflects the importance of family ties and marriage in Filipino culture, where it is not uncommon for parents to want to see their children settled down. This emphasis on family relationships is a key aspect of Philippine values.
qa_pairs.context:
The Frog Princess 
THE OLD KING was dying. So to his bedside he called his 
three sons, Diego, Pedro, and Juan. “You each go and 
look for your wives,” he said. “I should like to see the 
three of you married before I die.” 
“Yes, Father,” they replied and got set to go and seek 
for their wives.

As they were leaving, the king added, “Go your 
separate ways, knock at the door of the first house you 
come to, and whoever opens the door, ask her to marry 
you.” 
The three princes agreed to do wha

qa_pairs.question: What did Juan do when he came across an ugly frog at the door?
qa_pairs.answer: He asked the frog to marry him and took it home with him.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Juan's decision to ask the frog to marry him is a reflection of the Filipino concept of 'pakikisama' or social harmony, where one prioritizes getting along with others even if they are not conventionally attractive or desirable. This value is deeply ingrained in Philippine culture and is often seen as a key aspect of building strong relationships.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang pangalan ng lalaki na nag-ibig sa isang alaga niya ng katakut-takot?
qa_pairs.answer: Juan
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Si Juan, isang pag-ibig na magmahal ng kung sino man, kahit saan galing siya mula sa mundo.
qa_pairs.context:
At last came the great wedding day. Diego and Pedro 
were radiant with smiles as their brides leaned on their 
arms. For his part, Juan held the slimy green frog in his 
hand, and the people could hardly keep from laughing at 
him. The king was furious, but Juan insisted that he loved 
the frog and wanted to marry her. 
Just as the veils were about to be thrown over the 
couples, the frog whispered, “Juan, please crush me under 
your foot.” 
Juan was very much pleased to hear the frog speak 
hum

qa_pairs.question: Paano nagbago ang alaga ni Juan?
qa_pairs.answer: Naging prinsesa siya
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Siya ay muling naitalaga bilang isang ina ngunit sa pagkatao, naging prinsesa siya at pinalaya ang kanyang pamumuhay ni Juan.

qa_pairs.question: What is said to be the bridge taken by angels when they come down to earth?
qa_pairs.answer: The rainbow
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino culture, the rainbow is believed to be a symbol of good luck and prosperity, but in this story, it serves as a literal bridge for angels to descend to earth. The concept of angels taking a physical path to interact with humans is also rooted in Filipino Catholic traditions.
qa_pairs.context:
The Bridge 
of the Angels 
ONE DAY a young datu was 
standing on a mountainside. 
The sun shone over the 
valley, and he looked up to 
behold a rainbow forming in 
the sky. He saw one end of 
the rainbow bend toward the 
mountain on which he stood 
admiring its perfect shape 
and its bright colors. 
Then he remembered an 
old story he once heard about 
the rainbow. A white-haired 
old man had said that the 
rainbow was the bridge 
which the angels took when- 
ever they came down to 
earth. “That

qa_pairs.question: What did the young datu find at the foot of the rainbow?
qa_pairs.answer: A fragrant pool of water
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The discovery of a fragrant pool of water at the foot of the rainbow represents the harmony and balance that Filipinos strive for in nature. The emphasis on natural beauty and spiritual connection is also reflective of Filipino values.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang pangalan ng dalawang kaibigan na naglakbay sa coconut grove?
qa_pairs.answer: Yoyong at Mente
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang mga pangalan nila Yoyong at Mente ay mga halimbawa ng karaniwang pangalan sa Pilipinas, at ang kuwento nito ay isang paglalarawan ng katuturan ng pagiging tao sa kapwa.

go back to heaven. Let me go!”

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang salitang ginamit upang tukuyin ang isang espesyal na nilalang?
qa_pairs.answer: Tianak
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang salitang tianak ay isang malawak na kilala sa Pilipinas, at ito ay tumutukoy sa isang uri ng demonyong may katutulong.

qa_pairs.question: What is a tianak according to Aling Nenang?
qa_pairs.answer: A creature that can change its form, appears frightful but does not harm unless provoked or if the person is afraid
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino folklore, the tianak is a type of supernatural being that takes on various forms, often appearing as a frightening entity to scare people. However, according to Aling Nenang's explanation, it only bites when its victim shows fear, highlighting the cultural significance of this creature in Philippine mythology.
qa_pairs.context:
that he turned to run away. But the wake leaped after 
him and buried his sharp teeth in his arm. Mente 
screamed for help and when Yoyong heard him and saw 
the tianak, he became very much frightened, too. So he 
started running away and exclaiming: “Susmariosep! 
Susmariosep!” 
No sooner were the words out of Yoyong’s mouth 
than the tianak let go of Mente and vanished into the 
darkness. 
Then Yoyong and Mente forgot their anger and ran 
away as fast as ever you please.

qa_pairs.question: What is special about the tianak's right leg?
qa_pairs.answer: It is longer than its left leg
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In this Filipino folktale, the tianak's uneven legs serve as a symbolic representation of its supernatural abilities, emphasizing the cultural significance of unusual physical characteristics in Philippine mythology. The emphasis on the tianak's distinctive leg also highlights the importance of observation and interpretation in understanding the behaviors and habits of these mythical creatures.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang tawag sa lalaki na nagkaroon ng isang magandang anino o kiba-an?
qa_pairs.answer: Kiba-an
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang kiba-an ay isang di-nakikilalang entidad sa mga mitolohiyang katutubong Filipino, kabilang ang diyos-diyosan ng bangar na puno.
qa_pairs.context:
he wore the hat and found that no one, not even the dogs 
and wild birds, could see him. 
“I shall not tell my son about this hat till he is a grown- 
up man,” thought he, hiding it. “He might do unwise 
things with it if he gets it before he is old enough.” 
The next year when the bangar tree bloomed again, the 
fisherman grew so sick with the smell that he set out to cut 
down the tree. “Perhaps the kiba-an has moved into 
another tree,” he said.

qa_pairs.question: Anong pinagkatiwalaan ni lolo sa kaniyang anak?
qa_pairs.answer: Ang hat, ang chairs at ang purse
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang tatlo ay mga tanging pagbibigay ng lolo kay anak na siya'y pumalagi bilang pangunahing kahalagahan sa kapwa-panahon ng buhay. Ang gantimpala nito ang isanib sa pagtutubos at pakikilusap ng kaniyang anak.

qa_pairs.question: What was the object that granted invisibility to its wearer?
qa_pairs.answer: A hat
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The hat, a symbol of transformation and change in Filipino culture, allowed the young man to navigate through challenges and ultimately win his true love.

qa_pairs.question: What was the result of eating the red fruit on its banks?
qa_pairs.answer: The growth of two horns on the young man's head
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The fruit, reminiscent of the bountiful harvests in Filipino culture, brought physical transformation to the young man, teaching him about patience and self-discovery.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang mga ugat ng mga hari, Reyna, at Prinsesa?
qa_pairs.answer: Mga korni, fangs, at isang mahabang buntot
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Mga korni, fangs, at isang mahabang buntot na naglalarawan ng mga pagbabago sa loob ng isang kapapanganan, isang pangunahing thema sa tradisyonal na kuwento ng bayan natin.
qa_pairs.context:
Before long he reached a hill where he found another 
strange tree. He wondered what its fruit would give him. 
So he ate some, eagerly feeling all over his body to seek 
unusual growths. Before long he found thai he had a long 
tail. But he easily pulled out the tail. Then he broke off a 
branch from the tree and went on. 
This way and that way he walked, following many 
roads. At last, clothed in rags and wearing long hair anda 
long beard, he reached his native land. The fruits had 
strangely

qa_pairs.question: Paano ang mga bunga ng puno ay nakatulong upang mabawi ang kagandahang-loob ng Prinsesa?
qa_pairs.answer: Sa pagpapalaya sa mga ugat ng hari, Reyna, at Prinsesa
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Sa pamamagitan ng pagpapalaya sa mga ugat ng hari, Reyna, at Prinsesa, ang kagandahang-loob ng Prinsesa ay muling nakabuo, na may katibayan sa kahalagahan ng pag-ibayong-loob at pagsasauli sa kapwa natin.
